text: It is well established that <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is one of the major stimuli toward phosphorylation of NF-kappaB .
To confirm <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated signaling following SE , we performed an immunohistochemical study using five phospho - NF-kappaB antibodies .

Compared to non-SE animals ( data not shown ) , 12 hr-post SE animals of the saline-infused group showed <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser276 , <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser311 , <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser529 , and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser536 phosphorylation in astrocytes ( not endothelial cells ) .

s <extra_id_0> TNFp55R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> infusion effectively reduced <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser276 and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser311 phosphorylation ( p < 0.05 , respectively ) , while it could not affect <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser529 or <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser536 phosphorylation ( Figures 3 and 4A ) .

In contrast , <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Thr435 phosphorylation was increased in endothelial cells ( not astrocytes ) within the PC of saline-infused animals 12 hr after SE ( Figure 5A ) .

In addition , s <extra_id_0> TNFp55R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> infusion effectively alleviated SE - induced <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Thr435 phosphorylation in endothelial cells , compared to saline infusion ( p < 0.05 , Figure 5B ) .
